column1: Art Institute of Chicago////To rest our barking dogs (tired feet)
column2: my compatriot and I found a bench in front of Seurat's A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte.  A tour of businessmen (yes
column3: all men in suits that looked like they had just left a convention of lawyers)
column4: passed through around this point.  So as we sat there
column5: wondering if we could elevate our feet against a wall (we were channeling our yoga)
column6: this tour passed through and they congregated around the painting.  By default
column7: we also became part of the tour.  We learned a bit
column8: but also laughed quietly at the slightly boorish questions from the tour.
